CVE-2003-1500.title: cpCommerce _functions.php script PHP file include
CVE-2003-1500.body: cpCommerce could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files, caused by a vulnerability in the _functions.php script. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the _functions.php script that specifies a malicious PHP file from a remote or local system as a parameter, which would allow the attacker to execute code on the vulnerable server.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, available from the cpCommerce Web site. See References.

CVE-2003-1501.title: Gast Arbeiter could allow an attacker to upload files
CVE-2003-1501.body: Gast Arbeiter could allow a remote attacker to upload files to the system, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted message, which would allow the attacker to upload a file to the system. A remote attacker could use this vulnerability to gain elevated privileges on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1503.title: AOL Instant Messenger getfile long screenname buffer overflow
CVE-2003-1503.body: AOL Instant Messenger (AIM) is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. By creating a malicious aim:getfile URL containing a long screenname, a remote attacker can overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system, once the URL is clicked and the victim downloads the malicious file.Upgrade to the latest version of AIM (5.5.3415 Beta or later), available from the AOL Instant Messenger Web site. See References.

CVE-2003-1504.title: Goldlink variables.php could allow an attacker to gain administrative access
CVE-2003-1504.body: Goldlink could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized administrative access to the application, caused by a vulnerability in the variables.php script. By creating two specially-crafted cookies using the $vadmin_login and $vadmin_pass variables, a remote attacker could login to the panel and gain unauthorized administrative access to the Goldlink application.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1506.title: CensorNet CGI script cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1506.body: CensorNet is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote attacker could embed malicious script within a URL request to a vulnerable CGI script, which would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting site, once the link is clicked.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1513.title: Resin name and comment cross-scripting
CVE-2003-1513.body: Resin is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper filtering of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could embed malicious script in the name or comment variable in a specially-crafted URL request to the env.jsp, form.jsp, session.jsp or tictactoe.jsp script, which would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting site, once the link is clicked.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1514.title: eMule long password denial of service
CVE-2003-1514.body: eMule is vulnerable to a denial of service. A remote attacker could use the Web Control Panel to submit a long password, which could cause the server to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1515.title: ORIGO ASR-8100 router could allow an attacker to restore the factory default settings
CVE-2003-1515.body: ORIGO ASR-8100 ADSL router could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access and restore the factory default settings on the device. By telneting to port 254, a remote attacker can gain access to the configuration interface of the device and perform unauthorized configuration changes, which could result in a denial of service.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1518.title: WinSyslog long syslog message denial of service
CVE-2003-1518.body: WinSyslog is vulnerable to a denial of service. A remote attacker could send a long syslog message to the program to cause the system to hang.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1519.title: Vivísimo Clustering Engine cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1519.body: Vivísimo Clustering Engine is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper filtering of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could create a specially-crafted URL request containing malicious HTML or JavaScript, which would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the host, once the link is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials and other sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1522.title: VPOP3 login page cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1522.body: VPOP3 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper filtering of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could create a specially-crafted URL request to the login page containing malicious HTML or JavaScript, which would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the host, once the link is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials and other sensitive information.Upgrade to the latest version of VPOP3 (2.0.0g or later), available from the VPOP3 Web site. See References.

CVE-2003-1523.title: dbmail multiple parameters are vulnerable to SQL injection
CVE-2003-1523.body: dbmail is vulnerable to SQL injection, caused by vulnerabilities in the IMAP service. A remote attacker could insert arbitrary SQL code in multiple parameters, such as username and password, which would allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information, bypass authentication, and possibly add, modify or delete data in the backend database.Upgrade to the latest version of dbmail (1.2 or later), available from the dbmail Web site. See References.

CVE-2003-1524.title: PGPDisk information disclosure
CVE-2003-1524.body: PGPDisk, running on Microsoft Windows XP, could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. If a user mounts a PGPDisk and does not log off the system, the disk remains engaged. A local attacker with login access can use the Windows XP switch user function to obtain information stored on the encrypted partition of PGPDisk.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1529.title: J Walk URL encoded "dot dot" directory traversal
CVE-2003-1529.body: J Walk could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the Web server. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing hexadecimal URL encoded "dot dot" sequences (in the form of /.%252e/) to traverse directories and view any known file on the system, including the sam._ configuration file, which includes the Windows password.Upgrade to the latest version of J Walk (3.3c4 or later) when it becomes available, as listed in IRM Security Advisory No. 005. See References.

CVE-2003-1531.title: Ceilidh textcgi.exe cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1531.body: Ceilidh is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper filtering of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could create a specially-crafted URL request containing malicious script to the testcgi.exe file, which would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting site, once the link is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1536.title: DCP-Portal search.php and calendar.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1536.body: DCP-Portal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote attacker could embed malicious script within the ?fields variable in a specially-crafted URL request to the search.php script or within the ?year variable in a specially-crafted URL request to the calendar.php script, which would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting site, once the link is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1540.title: WF-Chat stores plaintext passwords and usernames in !nicks.txt and !pwds.txt
CVE-2003-1540.body: WF-Chat stores sensitive information insecurely in the !nicks.txt and !pwds.txt files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted URL request for the !nicks.txt or !pwds.txt file to obtain sensitive information, including plaintext usernames and passwords.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1541.title: Guestbook tr3.a plaintext passwords disclosed in passwd.txt file
CVE-2003-1541.body: Guestbook tr3.a could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request for the passwd.txt file to obtain the user's passwords in plain text. An attacker could then use this information to gain unauthorized access to the guestbook.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1543.title: Bajie error message cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1543.body: Bajie HTTP Web Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper filtering of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could create a specially-crafted URL request containing malicious HTML or Javascript, which would cause an error message to be displayed and the script to be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the host, once the link is clicked.Upgrade to the latest version of BBajie HTTP Web Server (0.95zxe1 or later), available from the Bajie Web site. See References.

CVE-2003-1546.title: Filebased guestbook gbook.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1546.body: Filebased guestbook is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote attacker could create a guestbook entry containing malicious HTML script embedded within the comment field, which would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting site, once the malicious entry is viewed.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1547.title: PHP-Nuke block-Forums.php subject field cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1547.body: PHP-Nuke is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by a vulnerability in the block-Forums.php file of the Splatt Forum module. A remote attacker could post a message that contains malicious script embedded within the subject field, which would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting site, once the message is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal a victim's cookies.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1548.title: MyABraCaDaWeb index.php could disclose Web root path
CVE-2003-1548.body: MyABraCaDaWeb could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. If a remote attacker submits a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script with an invalid value for the IDAdmin variable or other variables, the attacker would cause the Web server to return an error message that could contain the full path to the Web root directory, and possibly other sensitive information. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1549.title: MyABraCaDaWeb index.php ma_kw cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1549.body: MyABraCaDaWeb is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote attacker could embed malicious script within the ma_kw variable in a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script, which would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting site, once the link is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1550.title: XOOPS $xoopsOption Web root path disclosure
CVE-2003-1550.body: XOOPS could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. If a remote attacker submits a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script or another vulnerable script with an invalid value for the $xoopsOption variable, the attacker would cause the Web server to return an error message that could contain the full path to the Web root directory, and possibly other sensitive information. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1552.title: Uploader /uploads directory file upload
CVE-2003-1552.body: Uploader could allow a remote attacker to bypass password authentication and upload malicious PHP files. By default, the $ADMIN[RequirePass] variable in the setup.php script is set to "No". A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing a malicious PHP file to the /uploads directory, which would allow the attacker to upload the specified external PHP file to the system. An attacker could use this vulnerability to execute commands on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1553.title: SIPS configuration directory information disclosure
CVE-2003-1553.body: Haakon Nilsen Simple Internet Publishing System could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the storing of user credentials under the Web root. By sending a direct request to a user-specific configuration directory, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the password and other sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1554.title: ScozBook add.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1554.body: ScozNet ScozBook is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the add.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the username, useremail, aim, msn, sitename, or the siteaddy parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1555.title: ScozBook view.php path disclosure
CVE-2003-1555.body: ScozNet ScozBook could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the view.php scriptusing an invalid PG parameter to cause an error message to be returned containing the full installation path. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1557.title: SpamAssassin spamc BSMTP -B off-by-one buffer overflow
CVE-2003-1557.body: SpamAssassin is vulnerable to buffer overflow, caused by an off-by-one that can occur when "dot" characters (.) are improperly filtered from SMTP lines. If a user is using the SpamAssassin spamc program in BSMTP mode and calls the program with the -B option, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted email to the user to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the spamc user.As a workaround, apply the 3rd party patch for this vulnerability, as listed in the BugTraq Mailing List posting dated 2003-01-23 22:21:32. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Upgrade to the latest version of Mail-SpamAssasin (2.44 or later), as listed in Gentoo Linux Security Announcement 200302-01. See References.

CVE-2003-1558.title: fnord httpd.c source file overly long CGI request buffer overflow
CVE-2003-1558.body: fnord is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by a buffer overflow in the httpd.c source file. By sending an overly long CGI request to the Web server, a remote attacker can overflow a buffer and cause the server to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of fnord (1.7 or later), available from the fnord Web page. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Upgrade versions fnord-1.6 and earlier, as listed in Gentoo Linux Security Announcement 2003-01-9. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2003-1570.title: Tivoli Storage Manager console mode information disclosure
CVE-2003-1570.body: Tivoli Storage Manager console could allow a remote authenticated attacker with administrative privileges to obtain sensitive information, caused by a weakness in console mode. By starting an admin session in console mode, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to monitor activities on the TSM server.Refer to IBM Technote (FAQ) 1375360 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2003-1573.title: Sun J2EE PointBase SQL injection
CVE-2003-1573.body: The PointBase database component in the J2EE is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements related to "inadequate security settings and library bugs in sun.* and org.apache.* packages", which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database, obtain sensitive information and possibly cause a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of PointBase (4.8 or later), available from the PointBase Support Web page. See References.

CVE-2003-1574.title: TikiWiki username security bypass
CVE-2003-1574.body: TikiWiki could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the improper validation of user login credentials. By logging in using a valid username and password and activating the "remember me" option, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability and bypass the authentication process to gain unauthorized access to the system with the privileges of the victim.Upgrade to the latest version of TikiWiki (1.7.1.1 or later), available from the TikiWiki Web site. See References.

CVE-2003-1577.title: Sun ONE (aka iPlanet) Web Server iPlanet Log Analyzer cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1577.body: Sun ONE (aka iPlanet) Web Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the iPlanet Log Analyzer. If DNS resolution is enabled for client IP addresses, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an HTTP request in conjunction with a crafted DNS response to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 201453 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2003-1583.title: WebTrends domain name cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1583.body: WebTrends is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted client domain name, related to an Inverse Lookup Log Corruption (ILLC) issue to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1584.title: SurfStats domain name cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1584.body: SurfStats is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted client domain name, related to an Inverse Lookup Log Corruption (ILLC) issue to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1585.title: WebLogExpert domain name cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1585.body: WebLogExpert is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted client domain name, related to an Inverse Lookup Log Corruption (ILLC) issue to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1586.title: WebExpert User-Agent HTTP header cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1586.body: WebExpert is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the User-Agent HTTP header to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1587.title: LoganPro User-Agent HTTP header cross-site scripting
CVE-2003-1587.body: LoganPro is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the User-Agent HTTP header to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2003-1598.title: WordPress blog.header.php SQL injection
CVE-2003-1598.body: WordPress is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could insert arbitrary SQL code in the $posts variable in a request to the blog.header.php script, which would allow the attacker to add, modify or delete data in the backend database on some systems.Apply the blog.header.php patch, available from the WordPress Web page. See References.

CVE-2003-1599.title: WordPress links.all.php could allow an attacker to include PHP files
CVE-2003-1599.body: WordPress could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the links.all.php script that uses the $abspath variable to specify a malicious PHP file on a remote system, which could then be used by the attacker to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.
